html.p: A field is, essentially, a set in which one can add, subtract, multiply, and divide any two elements (other than dividing by zero). The formal definition is below.

The field that we will most commonly use in this course is the set of real numbers [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R[/mathjaxinline]. Other fields include the set of complex numbers [mathjaxinline]\mathbb C[/mathjaxinline], the set of rational numbers [mathjaxinline]\mathbb Q[/mathjaxinline], and the integers modulo a prime [mathjaxinline]p[/mathjaxinline].
